org.pircbotx

Class UtilSSLSocketFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.net.SocketFactory
      • javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory
        • org.pircbotx.UtilSSLSocketFactory

  • public class UtilSSLSocketFactory
extends SSLSocketFactory
    Utility for doing various useful things to an SSL socket factory.

    Most methods follow the builder pattern, meaning you can declare and setup this Socket Factory in one line

    Author:
    Trusting all certificates code by Howardism

    Disabling Diffie Hellman code by Sam on StackOverflow

    Implemented and Maintained in PircBotX by: Leon Blakey

    • Constructor Detail

      • UtilSSLSocketFactory

        public UtilSSLSocketFactory()

    • Method Detail

      • trustAllCertificates

        public UtilSSLSocketFactory trustAllCertificates()
        By default, trust ALL certificates. This is very insecure. It also defeats one of the points of SSL: Making sure your connecting to the right server. Cannot be combined with disableDiffieHellman(javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory) since this overwrites the wrapped factory and will throw an exception!
        Returns:
        The current UtilSSLSocketFactory instance

      • disableDiffieHellman

        public UtilSSLSocketFactory disableDiffieHellman()
        Disable the Diffie Hellman key exchange algorithm. This is useful to work around JDK bug #6521495 which throws an Exception when prime sizes are above 1024 bits.

        Note that this requires that the server supports other key exchange algorithms. This socket factory (nor any other built in Socket Factory) cannot connect to a server that only supports Diffie Hellman key exchange with prime sizes larger than 1024 bits.

        Also see PircBotX Issue #34

        Returns:
        The current UtilSSLSocketFactory instance

      • disableDiffieHellman

        public UtilSSLSocketFactory disableDiffieHellman(SSLSocketFactory sourceSocketFactory)
        Disable the Diffie Hellman key exchange algorithm using the provided SSL socket factory. Cannot be combined with disableDiffieHellman(javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory) since this overwrites the wrapped factory and will throw an exception!
        Parameters:
        sourceSocketFactory -
        Returns:
        The current UtilSSLSocketFactory instance
        See Also:
        disableDiffieHellman()
